## Lesson Objectives {data-background-image="/images/25/25.webp" data-background-opacity="0.1"}

- Discuss how users leave footprints online
    - and how the Internet does not provide true anonymity!
- Define what a social network is.
    - Why it is important to limit the amount of information shared.
    - How to limit the amount of information shared.
- Describe cookies and how they are used by web servers.
- Identify and define other common web-tracking mechanisms
    - and to what extent each can be restricted or mitigated.

## What is a tracker?

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=40%}
- Script that runs on a website or phone app
- Collects data about your activity
- Sends data to third parties
- Used for analytics
- Results in targeted advertising
:::
::: {.column width=60%}
![](https://i.redd.it/76e8w1j8oxj61.jpg)
:::
::::


## Cookies {timing=180}

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=70%}
- Web servers store small text files on your computer
- Sent back to server with every HTTP request
- Used to maintain session, login, and preferences
    - If you delete cookies, you get logged out
    - [Can someone steal your cookies?](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Firesheep)
- Can also be used to track you across websites
    - Sites can share cookies!
:::
::: {.column width=30%}
![](https://static.vecteezy.com/system/resources/previews/035/535/908/original/browser-cookie-3d-illustration-icon-png.png)
:::
::::

### Find cookies in your browser!

- Press `F12` to open Developer Tools
- Go to `Application` or `Storage` tab and look for `Cookies`


::: {.notes}

- Allows you to get back in
- Erase the stamp, you need to pay again
:::

## How much tracking? {timing=600 .smaller data-background-image="/images/25/25.webp" data-background-opacity="0.1"}

### Use one of the following tools

1. [Privacy Test](https://coveryourtracks.eff.org/)
1. [Blacklight: A Real-Time Website Privacy Inspector](https://themarkup.org/blacklight)
1. Firefox with [Enhanced Tracking Protection](https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/enhanced-tracking-protection-firefox-desktop)


### Visit a popular website (news, social media) and find out-
- How many trackers? Which ones?
- How many third-party cookies? Which ones?
- Can any of these trackers evade cookie blockers?
- Does the website track your keystrokes or mouse movements?
- Is this information shared with Facebook? Google?


## Social Media {timing=180}

- How much does it cost to run a social media platform?
- How do they make money?
- Who owns the data you upload?
- What can they do with it?
- What are the risks?

    - 23andMe hack


## Ethics Debate {timing=900 data-background-image="/images/25/25.webp" data-background-opacity="0.1"}

1. Signals intelligence, such as that [produced by the NSA](https://www.nsa.gov/Signals-Intelligence/Overview/), should be abolished.
1. Elementary school students should be allowed to use social media.
1. Individuals should have the [right to be forgotten](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Right_to_be_forgotten) by internet searches.


## What next?

- [Firefox](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/) - privacy-focused browser
- [DuckDuckGo](https://duckduckgo.com/privacy) - privacy-focused search engine
- [haveibeenpwned.com](https://haveibeenpwned.com/) - check if your information has been compromised
- [NextDNS](https://nextdns.io/) - DNS-based tracker blocker
- [Privacy Guides](https://www.privacyguides.org/)
- [PrivacyTools](https://www.privacytools.io/)
- [The Social Dilemma (2020)](https://www.netflix.com/title/81254224) - documentary on social media
- [The Great Hack (2019)](https://www.netflix.com/title/80117542) - documentary on Cambridge Analytica scandal
